attributes.action: charge and prosecute the organisers and participants of the Eurovision Song Contest for Crimes Against Humanity.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Recent independent studies into the causes of noise pollution have determined that the Eurovision Song Contest is by far the greatest contributor of unwanted and toxic sound in the modern world. Furthermore due to the severity of this aural effluence the aforementioned contest may constitute a “cruel and unusual punishment,” and is therefore banned under the Article 5 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights. We the British public demand the perpetrators of this criminal organisation are brought to immediate justice.

rejection.details: Government cannot prosecute individuals or organisations. It is the role of the police to investigate suspected crimes, and the role of the Crown Prosecution Service to decide whether there is a case to answer, and to prosecute.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
